title: State cooperative banks in Punjab to offer loans on crop residue management machines
desc: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann announced a new loan scheme from state cooperative banks for farmers to buy crop residue management machines. The scheme offers 80% subsidy to PACs and 50% subsidy to farmers on equipment purchases. It aims to reduce paddy straw burning by making rural credit more accessible.

title: Couple in Kamala Harris campaign ad Republican Farmers or Democratic Actors? Here’s the truth
desc: Recent claims regarding the couple featured in Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign ad have been revealed.

title: PM Modi releases additional Rs 2,000 cr under PM Kisan Yojana for Maharashtra farmers ahead of key polls
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi disbursed Rs 20,000 crore as the 18th instalment of the PM-KISAN scheme, benefiting over 9.4 crore farmers. Maharashtra received an additional Rs 2,000 crore under a state scheme. Modi also inaugurated the Banjara Virasat Museum and introduced advanced agricultural technologies and solar parks.

title: PM Kisan 18 installment: PM Modi releases latest installment of PM Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana; how to check beneficiary status
desc: The PM Kisan Yojana's 18th installment release will result in a total distribution under the scheme exceeding Rs 3.45 lakh crore, benefitting over 11 crore farmers worldwide and further solidifying the government's commitment to agricultural prosperity and rural development.

title: It is a personal decision: BJP's Babita Phogat on sister Vinesh Phogat contesting on Congress ticket
desc: Babita Phogat respects her cousin Vinesh Phogat's decision to run for Congress in the 2024 Haryana elections. Vinesh joined Congress last month after protesting against BJP's Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh. Babita encourages voters to participate actively. The BJP, aiming for a third term, faces competition from Congress, AAP, and various alliances.

title: Vote for Congress to bring change: Rahul, Kharge urge Haryana voters
desc: Rahul Gandhi and Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge urged Haryana voters to support Congress in the state elections, emphasizing issues like farmer prosperity, employment, women's safety, and social justice. They criticized BJP's decade-long rule for unemployment, corruption, and social inequalities. Voting is underway with major parties contesting.

title: PM Modi to release 18th instalment of Rs 20,000 cr under PM-KISAN; Maha farmers to get additional Rs 2,000 cr
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will release Rs 20,000 crore for the 18th instalment of the PM-KISAN scheme, benefiting over 9.4 crore farmers. The event in Washim, Maharashtra will also see the launch of new technologies in animal husbandry and the dedication of solar parks. Around 2.5 crore farmers will join this event through webcasts nationwide.

title: Aim to tackle the issue of mis-selling agri inputs, help in farmers selling their produce: Freshokartz
desc: Freshokartz works with a network of village level entrepreneurs (VLEs) to help farmers with agri inputs and find suitable prices for their produce.

title: SC slams Punjab, Haryana for not penalising farmers burning stubble
desc: The Supreme Court criticized the Punjab and Haryana governments and the Commission for Air Quality Management for failing to act against farmers burning stubble, which worsens Delhi-NCR air quality. The court noted that only nominal compensation had been collected and ordered compliance with existing directives, urging stronger enforcement within a week.

title: Punjab farmers hold rail roko protest to demand justice for Lakhimpur Kheri victims
desc: According to various reports, railways tracks near Punjab-Haryana Shambhu border were blocked as part of the protest.

title: PM Kisan Yojana 18th Installment: How to check status, expected amount, eligibility, and eKYC process
desc: PM Kisan Yojana: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will release the 18th installment of the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-Kisan) Yojana on October 5, 2024. The scheme offers ₹6,000 annually to eligible landholding farmers in India, divided into three installments of ₹2,000. Farmers must complete mandatory eKYC formalities to ensure direct benefit transfer into their bank accounts. This article provides detailed instructions on checking beneficiary status, completing eKYC, and understanding the scheme's eligibility criteria.

title: Haryana assembly elections: Farmers'protests could have been handled better, says Rao Inderjit Singh
desc: Union minister Rao Inderjit Singh is campaigning vigorously for the Haryana assembly elections, promoting his daughter Arti Rao and other candidates he recommended. Singh, who switched from Congress to BJP in 2014, is seen as a potential CM candidate. He addresses farmer protests and BJP rebels contesting as Independents.

title: Kangana Ranaut does U-turn on comments on farm laws, BJP distances itself, Congress seeks action
desc: BJP MP Kangana Ranaut retracted her call to reinstate the repealed farm laws, sparking controversy. The BJP distanced itself from her remarks, while the Congress demanded her expulsion and an explanation from PM Modi. The issue arises amid Haryana's election campaign, where protests against these laws were prominent.

title: 'Are you up to some mischief': Rahul Gandhi asks PM Modi to clarify stand on Kangana's remark on farm laws
desc: Rahul Gandhi criticized the BJP over MP Kangana Ranaut's remarks on reviving the three farm laws, demanding Prime Minister Narendra Modi clarify his stance. Ranaut later withdrew her comments, stating they were personal opinions. Gandhi warned that any attempt to revive the laws would face opposition from the INDIA bloc, emphasizing respect for the farmers who protested against them.

title: Kangana Ranaut says views on farm laws personal amid backlash
desc: BJP MP Kangana Ranaut clarified that her views on reinstating the repealed farm laws are personal and do not reflect the party's stance. The Himachal Pradesh BJP distanced itself from her statement. Ranaut made these remarks at an event in Mandi, emphasizing the benefits of the laws for farmers' financial stability and growth.

title: Country now knows BJP is anti-farmer mindset: Mallikarjun Kharge after Kangana Ranaut's remark on farm laws
desc: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the BJP over MP Kangana Ranaut's call to reinstate the repealed farm laws. Ranaut later retracted her statement, expressing regret. Kharge accused the Modi government of being anti-farmer and failing to fulfill promises made to farmers. He asserted that poll-bound states like Haryana would respond strongly to these remarks.

title: Haryana assembly polls: Elections to pivot around jobs, farmer protests, agniveer & Dalit votes
desc: Haryana is the first state to hold elections after the Lok Sabha polls, with Congress and BJP both having won five seats each. The state's political landscape is influenced by caste dynamics, farmer protests, and unemployment. Both parties are focusing on consolidating their vote bases, with Dalit votes seen as crucial this time.

title: Farmer groups urge people to defeat BJP in Haryana assembly polls
desc: Farmers under Samyukt Kisan Morcha and Kisan Mazdoor Morcha held a 'Kisan Mahapanchayat' in Pipli, urging people to defeat the BJP in Haryana's upcoming assembly polls. They have been protesting for a legal guarantee of minimum support price for crops and plan a 'rail roko' protest on October 3.

title: My three generations never paid farm electricity bills: Shiv Sena MP
desc: Union minister Prataprao Jadhav revealed that his family has not paid farm electricity bills for three generations. Speaking at an event for the Chief Minister Baliraja Free Electricity Scheme 2024, he mentioned giving money to engineers to replace burnt distribution panels. The scheme offers free electricity to farmers using pumps up to 7.5 horsepower.

title: Focus on youth, women, poor and farmers: PM Modi
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated his 74th birthday in Odisha, marking 100 days of his third term by launching the Subhadra scheme for women's welfare and other projects. He emphasized that youth, women, poor, and farmers are central to his policies. Modi also inaugurated development projects worth thousands of crores and highlighted major decisions for the welfare of various sections of society.

title: Congress Sikh leaders defend Rahul Gandhi's remarks
desc: After BJP leaders criticised Rahul Gandhi's comments in the US about Sikhs in India, Congress fielded Sikh leaders Pratap Singh Bajwa and Charanjit Singh Channi to defend him. They questioned the BJP's handling of the farmers' agitation and claimed that Sikhs worldwide supported Gandhi's statements.

title: Bajrang Punia says he will fight for women, farmers upon joining Congress
desc: Tokyo Olympics bronze medalist Bajrang Punia has joined the Congress party ahead of the Haryana Assembly elections. Punia expressed his support for women, farmers, and athletes, criticizing the BJP for not standing by them. He highlighted that Congress supported wrestlers during their protests in December 2023 without being asked.

title: Robert Vadra flays Kangana Ranaut on remarks over farmers' protest
desc: Robert Vadra, husband of Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, criticised BJP MP Kangana Ranaut for her remarks on farmers' protests. He asserted that she does not merit a place in Parliament due to her lack of education and self-centered attitude. Vadra emphasised the urgency of addressing women's safety and called for collective action from all political parties.

title: Third eye: Leaving protestors with no effigy to burn and Chennai to Delhi: To take NEP journey or not to?
desc: In an interesting turn of events, UP police seized an effigy of BJP MP Kangana Ranaut from protesting farmer groups, leaving them to chant slogans instead. Meanwhile, letters between Chennai and Delhi continue over the National Education Policy 2020, with TN CM Stalin urging PM Modi to delink Samagra Shiksha funds from the PM-SHRI scheme.

title: SAD (Amritsar) president Simranjit Mann makes derogatory comments on Kangana Ranaut
desc: Shiromani Akali Dal (Amritsar) president Simranjit Singh Mann made derogatory remarks against BJP MP Kangana Ranaut over her controversial comments on the farmers' protest. Mann's comments came in response to a recent interview where Ranaut suggested a 'Bangladesh-like situation' could have unfolded in India without its strong leadership. Mann was attending a party event in Karnal ahead of Haryana Assembly polls on October 1.

title: AAP Punjab farmers wing holds protest, demands Kangana Ranaut's termination from Lok Sabha
desc: AAP Punjab's farmers wing protested against BJP MP Kangana Ranaut’s remarks on the farmers' protest and demanded her expulsion from the party. The protesters accused her of spreading hatred and called for legal action. The police detained protesters near the BJP office. The Himachal Pradesh Assembly also condemned her comments.

title: 'BJP's script': SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Kangana Ranaut's remarks on farmers' protests
desc: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticized BJP MP Kangana Ranaut for her comments on the farmers' protests, claiminig that her remarks were scripted by the BJP. The BJP, distancing itself from Ranaut's statements, emphasized that she is not authorized to speak on party policies and urged her not to make such comments again.

title: Rahul Gandhi slams BJP over Kangana Ranaut's remarks, calls it grave insult to farmers of India
desc: Kangana Ranaut had posted a clip of her interview with Hindi daily Dainik Bhaskar in which she suggested that a "Bangladesh-like situation" could have erupted in India but for the country's strong leadership. She then alleged that bodies were hanging and rapes were taking place during the farmers' protest against the now-repealed three farm laws.

title: Rahul Gandhi attacks BJP over Kangana Ranaut's comment, says 'proof of anti-farmer policy'
desc: In response to Kangana Ranaut's controversial remarks on the farmer protests, Rahul Gandhi claimed the BJP's propaganda machinery disrespects farmers. He mentioned the sacrifice of 700 farmers during the 378-day protest and noted that labeling them as rapists and foreign agents underscores the BJP's anti-farmer stance and intentions.
